newsitem.title: USA: RESEARCH ALERT-No big Microsoft upside seen.
newsitem.headline: RESEARCH ALERT-No big Microsoft upside seen.

text.p: Goldman Sachs analyst Rick Sherlund said Microsoft Corp is likely to meet Wall Street expectations for the quarter, according to a Goldman source.

However, Sherlund said "investors should not be anticipating an upside in the quarter to any great degree," unlike the previous two quarters, when the software giant's results greatly exceeded expectations, according to the source.
According to Zacks, the Wall Street estimates range from $0.76 per share to $0.81 for the fourth quarter, ending in June.
Sherlund estimates the company will earn $2.60 in 1997, and $3.10 for 1998. He continues to have the stock on the recommended list.
